Title: Male Figure Holding a Vase
Description: Figures holding vases are common in Mesopotamian art and are associated with the importance of fresh water for agriculture.
Provenance: Mrs. Henry Walters, New York; Sale, Joseph Brummer, New York, 1941; Walters Art Museum, 1941, by purchase.
Creator: Babylonian
Images: PS1_48.1808_3QtrLft_DD_T14.jpg, PS1_48.1808_3QtrRt_DD_T14.jpg, PS1_48.1808_Back_DD_T14.jpg, PS1_48.1808_Fnt_DD_T14.jpg, PS1_48.1808_Lft_DD_T14.jpg, PS1_48.1808_Rt_DD_T14.jpg
DisplayLocation: Centre Street: Second Floor: Ancient Near Eastern Art
